channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JQE55XAYB5985S1ZR0C26J53
item.description:
To suppress the #delegation warning in #PowerApps while using #Sharepoint as the datasource, here’s the formula that worked when using the Search function:

    With(
        { MyCollection:
            Filter('Bank Transactions',
                !\*chkBankCode\_1\*.Checked || StartsWith(MPIRefID,\*cmbBankCode\_1\*.Selected.Title),
                !\*chkDateFrom\_1\*.Checked || ((Date >= \*dpDateFrom\_1\*.SelectedDate) && (Date <= \*dpDateTo\_1\*.SelectedDate)),
                !\*chkAmtFrom\_1\*.Checked || ((Amount >= Value(\*txtInputAmtFrom\_1\*.Value)) && (Amount <= Value(\*txtInputAmtTo\_1\*.Value))),
                !\*chkCancelled\_1\*.Checked || (Status = Blank()),
                !\*chkCleared\_1\*.Checked || (Closed = false) || (Closed = Blank()),
                !\*chkDebits\_1\*.Checked || (Amount > 0),
                !\*chkTnxType\_1\*.Checked || (TnxType = \*cmbTnxType\_1\*.Selected.ID)
            )
        },
        ClearCollect(BankTnxSearchColl,Search(MyCollection,\*txtInputOtherInfo\_1\*.Value,'Other Info')
    );
item.content:encoded:
To suppress the #delegation warning in #PowerApps while using #Sharepoint as the datasource, here’s the formula that worked when using the Search function:

    With(
        { MyCollection:
            Filter('Bank Transactions',
                !\*chkBankCode\_1\*.Checked || StartsWith(MPIRefID,\*cmbBankCode\_1\*.Selected.Title),
                !\*chkDateFrom\_1\*.Checked || ((Date >= \*dpDateFrom\_1\*.SelectedDate) && (Date <= \*dpDateTo\_1\*.SelectedDate)),
                !\*chkAmtFrom\_1\*.Checked || ((Amount >= Value(\*txtInputAmtFrom\_1\*.Value)) && (Amount <= Value(\*txtInputAmtTo\_1\*.Value))),
                !\*chkCancelled\_1\*.Checked || (Status = Blank()),
                !\*chkCleared\_1\*.Checked || (Closed = false) || (Closed = Blank()),
                !\*chkDebits\_1\*.Checked || (Amount > 0),
                !\*chkTnxType\_1\*.Checked || (TnxType = \*cmbTnxType\_1\*.Selected.ID)
            )
        },
        ClearCollect(BankTnxSearchColl,Search(MyCollection,\*txtInputOtherInfo\_1\*.Value,'Other Info')
    );

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JQ9BJ2G9CKNA39AGVGRQFKX8
item.description: The use of Name and Folder path columns to filter a #Sharepoint Document Library is not delegable in #PowerApps. I don’t think they can even be compared to Sharepoint Lists because these metadata don’t exist in the latter: deuts.org/∞
item.content:encoded: The use of Name and Folder path columns to filter a #Sharepoint Document Library is not delegable in #PowerApps. I don’t think they can even be compared to Sharepoint Lists because these metadata don’t exist in the latter: deuts.org/∞

item.title: Steps to deny Power Apps users access to SharePoint data from the SharePoint UI - michelcarlo
item.description:
Steps to deny Power Apps users access to SharePoint data from the SharePoint UI - michelcarlo

How to block users from opening contents from a site directly in the SharePoint interface while still allowing the access from Power Apps.
Unfortunately, I can’t seem to make this work in our organization.
item.content:encoded:
Steps to deny Power Apps users access to SharePoint data from the SharePoint UI - michelcarlo

How to block users from opening contents from a site directly in the SharePoint interface while still allowing the access from Power Apps.
Unfortunately, I can’t seem to make this work in our organization.

item.title: Power Apps ParseJSON Function: Get Collection From A Flow
item.description:
Power Apps ParseJSON Function: Get Collection From A Flow

Power Apps new ParseJSON function converts a text string into a record or table. It can also be used to return a collection from a flow.
I think this is the way to limit access of my Power Apps users to the underlying Sharepoint List.
item.content:encoded:
Power Apps ParseJSON Function: Get Collection From A Flow

Power Apps new ParseJSON function converts a text string into a record or table. It can also be used to return a collection from a flow.
I think this is the way to limit access of my Power Apps users to the underlying Sharepoint List.

item.title: PowerIcons - The Easiest Way to Customize Icons for Power Apps
item.description:
PowerIcons - The Easiest Way to Customize Icons for Power Apps

Customize, copy & paste icons into Power Apps without wasting time on complex SVG codes. Quick, easy, and ready to use.
Lots of customization options here I think.
item.content:encoded:
PowerIcons - The Easiest Way to Customize Icons for Power Apps

Customize, copy & paste icons into Power Apps without wasting time on complex SVG codes. Quick, easy, and ready to use.
Lots of customization options here I think.

item.title: Notemod: Note-Taking App Free & Open Source
item.description:
Notemod: Note-Taking App Free & Open Source

At Notemod, we believe that taking notes should be simple, powerful, and accessible to everyone. Whether you’re a student, professional, or creative thinker, Notemod is designed to streamline your note-taking experience with a modern touch.
We’ll never run out of options.
item.content:encoded:
Notemod: Note-Taking App Free & Open Source

At Notemod, we believe that taking notes should be simple, powerful, and accessible to everyone. Whether you’re a student, professional, or creative thinker, Notemod is designed to streamline your note-taking experience with a modern touch.
We’ll never run out of options.

item.title: How to Install UVdesk on Your Synology NAS
item.description:
How to Install UVdesk on Your Synology NAS

Step by step guide for installing UVdesk on your Synology NAS device.
This install process tutorial is based on Synology NAS and Portainer, but I’m sure I can make this work in my setup.
item.content:encoded:
How to Install UVdesk on Your Synology NAS

Step by step guide for installing UVdesk on your Synology NAS device.
This install process tutorial is based on Synology NAS and Portainer, but I’m sure I can make this work in my setup.

item.title: Self-Hosted Ticketing with Peppermint: Open-Source Helpdesk Setup!
item.description:
Self-Hosted Ticketing with Peppermint: Open-Source Helpdesk Setup!

Looking for a self-hosted ticketing system? In this video, I dive into Peppermint, a lightweight and open-source helpdesk solution that you can host yourself! I’ll walk you through the installation process using Docker, explore its key features, and show how it can be used for managing support tickets efficiently. Whether you’re running a business or just need a structured way to handle requests, Peppermint is a great self-hosted alternative to traditional ticketing systems.

I checked out Peppermint, and here are my initial impressions:
item.content:encoded:
Self-Hosted Ticketing with Peppermint: Open-Source Helpdesk Setup!

Looking for a self-hosted ticketing system? In this video, I dive into Peppermint, a lightweight and open-source helpdesk solution that you can host yourself! I’ll walk you through the installation process using Docker, explore its key features, and show how it can be used for managing support tickets efficiently. Whether you’re running a business or just need a structured way to handle requests, Peppermint is a great self-hosted alternative to traditional ticketing systems.

I checked out Peppermint, and here are my initial impressions:

  • There’s no search function
  • No way to edit issue types
  • I liked the simple and sleek design
